messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Deb L's writings
messages.msgSnippet: That was nice Sandra, thank you.   As I look back through my in box here I see your name over and over and your writing,  always so calm and clear, and those
messages.messageBody:
That was nice Sandra, thank you. As I look back through my in box here
I see your name over and over and your writing, always so calm and
clear, and those are the ones I save and make my husband read and anyone
else who might be remotely interested. At least once a week I tell
someone on the Montana unschoolers list to go to sandradodd.com because I
know you can make the light come on for anyone who's tired of being in
the dark. So, there are words on a page, and then there's writing, and
you're awesome.

Deb L, now collecting dues for the Sandra Dodd fan club... ( hey!)


> I have 531 unread e-mails, but I HOPE some of them are pointing out
> to you
> that writing on lists like this and saying things that make other
> people
> think and change is as real as writing gets and that you do it
> well.
>
> Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Deb L's writings
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/7/02 12:30:51 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:   Maniacal Musings ?   The Obnoxious Opinions
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/7/02 12:30:51 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< <G> "Maniacal Musings"? "The Obnoxious Opinions of a Nobody"?

You's funny! I can't even write a shopping list... >> >>

You're one of my favorite writers here Deb! Don't knock yourself.

Ren

messages.subject: Deb L's writings
messages.msgSnippet: Deb, I have 531 unread e-mails, but I HOPE some of them are pointing out to you that writing on lists like this and saying things that make other people think
messages.messageBody:
Deb,

I have 531 unread e-mails, but I HOPE some of them are pointing out to you
that writing on lists like this and saying things that make other people
think and change is as real as writing gets and that you do it well.

Sandra

<< > I just thought this needed repeating. Maybe Deb should write a
> book.

<G> "Maniacal Musings"? "The Obnoxious Opinions of a Nobody"?

You's funny! I can't even write a shopping list... >>
